intro.text: Loving Kindness meditation cultivates compassion by extending good wishes to yourself and others. Start with yourself, then gradually expand to loved ones, neutral people, difficult people, and all beings.

sections.title: Loving Kindness for Yourself
sections.instructions: Find a quiet space and take a few deep breaths. Focus on yourself and send positive wishes:
sections.phrases: May I be safe, may I be healthy, may I be happy, may I be at peace
sections.additionalInstructions: Repeat these phrases slowly and intentionally, imagining warmth spreading through your body.
sections.reflectionPlaceholder: How did it feel to send loving kindness to yourself? What did you notice?

sections.title: Loving Kindness for a Loved One
sections.instructions: Think of someone you really care about - a family member, friend, or someone you want to send positive wishes to:
sections.phrases: May you be safe, may you be happy, may you be healthy, may you be at peace
sections.additionalInstructions: Visualize this person and imagine your loving wishes reaching them.
sections.reflectionPlaceholder: Who did you choose? How did it feel to send them loving kindness?

sections.title: Loving Kindness for a Neutral Person
sections.instructions: If you're ready, try offering loving kindness toward someone you neither feel close to nor have conflict with — perhaps a barista, a coworker you don't know well, or someone you see regularly but don't interact with much. You can repeat silently:
sections.phrases: "May you be safe, may you be happy, may you be healthy, may you be at peace."
sections.additionalInstructions: There's no need to feel anything specific — just offer the words with openness. You can skip this step anytime it feels off or too difficult.

sections.title: Loving Kindness for a Difficult Person
sections.instructions: If you're ready, try sending loving kindness toward someone you've had difficulties with. You don't have to agree with them:
sections.phrases: May you be safe, may you be happy, may you be healthy, may you be at peace
sections.additionalInstructions: This is challenging - start small and be gentle with yourself. You can skip this step if it feels too difficult today.
sections.reflectionPlaceholder: How did this feel? What did you notice? It's okay if this was difficult.

overallReflection.title: Overall Reflection
overallReflection.instructions: Take a moment to reflect on your entire Loving Kindness practice. How did it feel to extend compassion to different people?
overallReflection.label: Overall Reflection:
overallReflection.placeholder: What did you learn about yourself? How did your feelings change throughout the practice? What was most challenging or surprising?
